ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: A compilation of more than 80 functions designed to quantitatively and visually evaluate prediction performance of regression (continuous variables) and classification (categorical variables) of point-forecast models (e.g. APSIM, DSSAT, DNDC, supervised Machine Learning). For regression, it includes functions to generate plots (scatter, tiles, density, & Bland-Altman plot), and to estimate error metrics (e.g. MBE, MAE, RMSE), error decomposition (e.g. lack of accuracy-precision), model efficiency (e.g. NSE, E1, KGE), indices of agreement (e.g. d, RAC), goodness of fit (e.g. r, R2), adjusted correlation coefficients (e.g. CCC, dcorr), symmetric regression coefficients (intercept, slope), and mean absolute scaled error (MASE) for time series predictions. For classification (binomial and multinomial), it offers functions to generate and plot confusion matrices, and to estimate performance metrics such as accuracy, precision, recall, specificity, F-score, Cohen's Kappa, G-mean, and many more. For more details visit the vignettes <https://adriancorrendo.github.io/metrica/>.

A compilation of more than 80 functions designed to quantitatively and visually evaluate prediction performance of regression (continuous variables) and classification (categorical variables) of point-forecast models (e.g. APSIM, DSSAT, DNDC, supervised Machine Learning). For regression, it includes functions to generate plots (scatter, tiles, density, & Bland-Altman plot), and to estimate error metrics (e.g. MBE, MAE, RMSE), error decomposition (e.g. lack of accuracy-precision), model efficiency (e.g. NSE, E1, KGE), indices of agreement (e.g. d, RAC), goodness of fit (e.g. r, R2), adjusted correlation coefficients (e.g. CCC, dcorr), symmetric regression coefficients (intercept, slope), and mean absolute scaled error (MASE) for time series predictions. For classification (binomial and multinomial), it offers functions to generate and plot confusion matrices, and to estimate performance metrics such as accuracy, precision, recall, specificity, F-score, Cohen's Kappa, G-mean, and many more. For more details visit the vignettes <https://adriancorrendo.github.io/metrica/>.

name: r-metrica
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.1.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-metrica
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/metrica_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/metrica/metrica_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 935d030dbaf7aedb22b0500a602fa34c331b29fad7499c010b438ddf14a867c1

build:
  number: 2
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-dbi
    - r-rsqlite
    - r-dplyr
    - r-energy
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-ggpp
    - r-minerva
    - r-rlang
    - r-tidyr
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-dbi
    - r-rsqlite
    - r-dplyr
    - r-energy
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-ggpp
    - r-minerva
    - r-rlang
    - r-tidyr

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('metrica')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('metrica')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://adriancorrendo.github.io/metrica/
  license: MIT
  summary: A compilation of more than 80 functions designed to quantitatively and visually evaluate prediction performance of regression (continuous variables) and classification (categorical variables) of point-forecast models (e.g. APSIM, DSSAT, DNDC, supervised Machine Learning). For regression, it includes functions
    to generate plots (scatter, tiles, density, & Bland-Altman plot), and to estimate error metrics (e.g. MBE, MAE, RMSE), error decomposition (e.g. lack of accuracy-precision), model efficiency (e.g. NSE, E1, KGE), indices of agreement (e.g. d, RAC), goodness of fit (e.g. r, R2), adjusted correlation coefficients (e.g.
    CCC, dcorr), symmetric regression coefficients (intercept, slope), and mean absolute scaled error (MASE) for time series predictions. For classification (binomial and multinomial), it offers functions to generate and plot confusion matrices, and to estimate performance metrics such as accuracy, precision, recall, specificity,
    F-score, Cohen's Kappa, G-mean, and many more. For more details visit the vignettes <https://adriancorrendo.github.io/metrica/>.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
